#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Become a Kurd
#Text=Lots of people become Kurds and this will give you some tips and tricks onbecoming one .
#Text=Be aware that becoming a Kurd is not for the faint-hearted .
#Text=Do not become a Kurd just for the " good bits " .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Decide what kind of Kurd you want to be .
#Text=There are Turkish Kurds , Syrian Kurds , Iraqi Kurds , Iranian Kurds , Sorani Kurds , Kurmanji Kurds and Hawrami Kurds .
#Text=Do some internet research or find a book about Kurds at a library or bookstore to help make this decision .
#Text=One should only become the kind of Kurd they can relate to the most .
#Text=Adhere to the religion .
#Text=Some 90 % of Kurds are Sunni Muslims following the Shafi legal code .
#Text=Luckily , conversion to Islam is very easy , one just needs to declare their faith , either to themselves or officially in a mosque .
#Text=The other 10 % are Yazidis , Yarsanis and Alevis .

#Text=While it is difficult to convert to Yazidism , Yarsanism and Alevism are much more accepting of converts and if you live in a big city , you should be able to find a Cemevi or a Yarsani temple .
#Text=Most Kurds focus more on being Kurds than being religious , so you do n't need to be overly religious or take part in all the religious rituals .
#Text=It 's more about being part of the group than anything else .
#Text=Change your name .
#Text=Usually you can legally change your name if you are 18 , but it depends where you live .
#Text=If you are a Turkish Kurd , you should choose a Kurdish first name and Turkish surname as Kurdish surnames are banned in Turkey .
#Text=If you are an Iraqi Kurd , choose a Kurdish first name , a religious male middle name and surname , and then a tribal or geographical designator .
#Text=If you are an Iranian Kurd , choose a Kurdish first name and an Iranian surname .
#Text=Dress and look like a Kurd .
#Text=This does not mean wearing traditional garb all the time , even though it is a wise idea to have a brown or olive green suit ( for men ) or a dress ( for women ) .
#Text=You can buy these from online stores , Ebay , and specialist shops .
#Text=Kurdish girls wear heavy makeup and have thick eyebrows and long lashes .
#Text=If you are female , invest in some eyebrow pencil , foundation and mascara , or get your eyebrows tinted .
#Text=If you are female and you are an Iraqi Kurd or Iranian Kurd , you might be expected to put a scarf over most of your hair .
#Text=It should be stylish , possibly designer .
#Text=Do n't forget the oversized sunglasses .
#Text=If you are male , wear baggy jeans , sports clothes , cologne or perfume , and always be clean-shaven .
#Text=Try to learn the lingo .
#Text=While textbooks and online resources for learning Kurdish are limited , it is possible to find a private tutor or go to a group language learning class , if you live in a European city .
#Text=If you live in a Midwestern hick town , you 're out of luck .
#Text=This is n't mandatory , but it is recommended that learn a third language depending on what kind of Kurd you are .
#Text=An Iranian Kurd would learn Farsi , an Iraqi Kurd would learn Arabic , and a Turkish Kurd would learn Turkish .
#Text=If you have a knack for languages , why not learn all three ?
#Text=Resources for these are much more abundant .
#Text=Meet other Kurds .
#Text=Join the community .
#Text=The aforementioned cities , like London , Paris and Berlin , should have Kurdish community centres where you can attend meetings , celebrations , commemorations , and protests .
#Text=Meeting other Kurds can also help with learning the language and finding love .
#Text=It is better for Kurds to marry other Kurds .
#Text=Be prepared to go to lots of protests .
#Text=Making signs and banners is a great way to bond with new friends .
#Text=Just stay safe !
#Text=Protests , especially at night , can be dangerous for young people on their own and could even get you arrested so make sure you stay in a group .
#Text=Get official documentation .
#Text=Sadly , there is no such thing as a " Kurdish passport " but you can apply for an Iranian , Iraqi , or Turkish passport , and an ID card in Iraq and Turkey .

#Text=If you have a passport that might make travelling to the Homeland difficult , like an American passport if you are an Iranian Kurd , that and your American citizenship might need to be renounced .
#Text=Consider marriage .
#Text=Marrying an Iranian citizen ( hopefully a Kurd ) will automatically give you Iranian citizenship .
#Text=Develop your political views .
#Text=Keep in mind that Kurdish people talk politics as often as English people talk weather .
#Text=If you are a Turkish Kurd , you would probably support the left-wing HDP .
#Text=The leader is currently imprisoned .
#Text=Disagreement with Erdogan is de rigueur .
#Text=Campaign for your basic human rights .

#Text=If you are an Iraqi Kurd , you already have a semi-autonomous jurisdiction ... and a problem with nepotism and corruption , so you would show a certain amount of distrust of the local govt. Campaign for further independence .
#Text=If you are an Iranian Kurd , you would generally not vote , having similar distrust for the govt. Campaign for the abolition of the death penalty .
#Text=Prepare to confront haters .
#Text=Sadly , even in this day and age , many people wo n't respect your decision to live as a Kurd so you need to be able to discuss it with them in a civilised way .
#Text=Do n't be overly zealous with people who might not be sympathetic .
#Text=Some subjects are only suitable for discussion with other Kurds .
#Text=Be articulate and confident .
#Text=You can practice this by joining a debate club , Model Un , or toastmasters .
#Text=Be prepared to be called " other " and " enemy " and " terrorist " .
#Text=This may be distressing so it helps if you consistently tell yourself that you are n't .
